title: Data for 61 semi-structured interviews with biogas owners in Malawi
text: Within Sub-Saharan Africa, biogas projects seen significant investment, chequered record success. Although potential biogas well covered contemporary literature, biogas owners, relationship project outcomes, remains underexplored. Focusing southern Malawi, combining qualitative interviews owners, -site socio-technical investigation, purpose research explore role individual owners contributing project success failure. dataset represents complete sample biogas installations (time research) located within Malawi’s Southern Region. dataset consists 61 semi-structured interviews biogas owners, conducted multiple visits sites course two-year period June 2021 October 2022. data supplemented additional data collection, include published dataset, consisting 20 unstructured interviews, field notes, participatory observation, detailed socio-technical analysis digester system, countless impromptu conversations, Whatsapp discussions, phone calls. Sites identified initial scoping phase study, involved exhaustive search biogas sites within secondary documents consultations key stakeholders within country, including biogas installers representatives Malawi Energy Regulatory Authority. Inclusion participation centred ownership biogas system. one interview per biogas site conducted. sites one relevant stakeholder/owner, stakeholders willing interviewed included interview. Interviews conducted local language (Chichewa), audio recorded, transcribed English. Participation voluntary withdrawn time. Respondents providing written, informed consent, responses recorded anonymously. study received ethical approval National Committee Research Social Sciences Humanities, Protocol . P.03/21/560.

title: Data for 61 semi-structured interviews with biogas owners in Malawi
text: Description: Utilised interview schedule Chichewa. Interviews loosely structured, narrative focus, allow respondents tell stories, share experiences digesters. Interviews also included substantial participatory elements, owners, particularly households, allowing researchers join throughout daily routines, including daily regimen feeding, maintenance, use biodigester system, applicable.

title: Data for 61 semi-structured interviews with biogas owners in Malawi
text: Description: Socio-technical site analysis biogas plant conducted using checklist adapted troubleshooting guidelines published AGAMA Biogas (Ayres, 2018). Sites operation tested number criteria including: gas pressure, flame colour, pH (reactive chamber digestate).
